intro: Minuartia idaea, commonly known as the common rock-cress, is a small, mat-forming flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is typically found growing on rocky substrates in alpine and arctic regions. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers with four petals, and its leaves are usually scale-like or linear. It is adapted to harsh environments, exhibiting a low growth habit to minimize exposure to wind and cold. Minuartia idaea is often used in ecological studies due to its sensitivity to environmental changes.
